thread.title: Shanghai stock exchange OKs Didi Chuxing's $1.6 billion shelf offering

title: Shanghai stock exchange OKs Didi Chuxing's $1.6 billion shelf offering
text: March 19, 2018 / 10:38 AM / Updated 12 minutes ago Shanghai stock exchange OKs Didi Chuxing's $1.6 billion shelf offering Reuters Staff 1 Min Read (Reuters) - The Shanghai Stock Exchange has approved a 10 billion yuan ($1.58 billion) shelf offering by Chinese ride-hailing firm Didi Chuxing, the company said on Monday. A woman walks past Didi Chuxing's booth at the Global Mobile Internet Conference (GMIC) 2017 in Beijing, China April 28, 2017. REUTERS/Jason Lee The funds will be used for transport supply chain financing, allowing car leasing enterprises to procure new vehicles which will in turn expand capacity on Didiâ€™s platform. The initial size of the offering will be 300 million yuan. ($1 = 6.3301 Chinese yuan renminbi) Reporting by Cate Cadell
